content: I also got this email on Monday from the Partner who interviewed me. I had coffee yesterday with the Partner for about an hour and they just spoke about their team a bit more and the activities Clayton Utz does such as soccer teams etc. it was very relaxed. I asked my buddy about it and they said that it’s a new method they are trialling this year for clerks they potentially definitely want. My buddy said that there are 4 categories- clerks they definitely want, potentially want, maybe and no. Not sure how reliable that information is though

content:
Clutz is sick of losing grads to HSF, KMW and Allens. In Brisbane Clutz and Minters are 70% government work / projects. If you want corporate, finance etc you avoid them. If you want employment, planning or projects great firms
And the more time they put into you the more they want you. In any clerkship group there are standouts a firm must have. Usually 5-10 clerks max. After that there is a bigger list they fill the next 5-40 places from
raw_content:

content:
The big 3: KWM,HSF,Allens are great firms to choose if you can. Within those, KWM’s Asia connection is good if you want to potentially work in Asia in the future. The other two all got British links and are great firms.
Clutz got more gov work so if you value work life balance, working in the gov sphere would give you a bit more breath in life. However Clutz I believe got the lowest pay and less perks then other.
Then you have Minters, Ashurst.
Corrs and G+T is at the T6 level as well.
